column4: I just bought a new laptop and dual booted ubuntu along side windows 7
now i deleted the partition with ubuntu on as i did not like ubuntu
and now want to stick with windows 7
now i restarted my pc
and now i cant get it to boot up
it just says error: no such partition
grub rescue>
sorry
but its not a windows situation
grub is part of ubuntu
http://godbyte.com/blog/2010/windows-7-wont-boot-after-removing-ubuntu
By "dropping to the command line" he means recovery console.
you can download recovery disks
have a look for FalconFour's ultimate boot CD, that has a windows 7 recovery kit on it.
see my message.
free: http://falconfour.wordpress.com/2011/03/12/falconfours-ultimate-boot-cdusb-4-5/
so how do I put this on USB and make sure it boots from USB?
It's a bit tricky to boot it from USB
the windows recovery system isn't compatible with what dr_willis said.
there is a readme file in the archive for once it's downloaded.
how do i use that boot prog as a recovery disk?
